Arcane Holocaust

The Arcane Holocaust was the conflict between the ancient civilisations of Graadien and Darohl culminating in the development and deployment of the Soul Bomb against Darohl, and subsequent sacking of Graadien by the Charon.

Soul Bombs

Soul Bombs were used in the holocaust from the moment of their invention, and each one differed as Graadien mages experimented with different techniques. Generally speaking, those used nearest to their invention were the most physically destructive and magically contaminating, with later bombs designed either to destroy a limited area or populace, while leaving any desirable assets or territories nearby uncontaminated. This advancement was largely owed to a design which captured the energy of a soul bomb and channeled it inward, into a mana_crystal, containing arcane corruption and reducing the chance of a chain reaction.

Because of this, the remains of Darohl most highly corrupted and dangerous at the year_zero are those near the center, where the earliest, most destructive weapons were intended to cause the most damage and terror as possible. The innermost holds of Darohl remain intact, though monsters descended from the events outside now roam those forgotten halls. The outskirts of the city are mostly intact - in part due to efforts to fortify and seal off the place by the last stragglers of its dying populace - with architecture still standing strong where the later soul bombs were detonated; they are, like the inner holds, patrolled by manifold horrors, but brave adventurers sometimes venture near for the promise of valuable mana_crystals that might be found there.
